title.value: Воспроизводительные и продуктивные качества мясных кроликов
Reproductive and productive qualities of meat rabbits
Reproductive and productive qualities of meat rabbits

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Norejko, A.Yu., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented the data of researches on studying of reproductive and productive qualities of rabbits of specialized meat breeds (New Zealand white, Californian, and hyplus). Three experimental groups from young (4,5-5 months) doe-rabbits breeds of a meat productivity direction on 10 heads in everyone have been generated. The covering of doe-rabbits was carried out males of analyzed breeds. As object of researches at studying productive qualities served one-age young animals, transplanted from doe-rabbits of the specified breeds, from which have been generated groups on 25 heads in everyone. It is established that from doe-rabbits of the specified breeds by the time of change of cubs counting on one female, it is possible to receive not less than 6,8-8,0 rabbits, at their safety of 88,3-94,1%. The greatest intensity of growth at young growth is noticed in 45-90 days that was showed by monthly average increase in a pure gain of live weight for the given period to 654,0-1000 g and a daily average gain at level of 28,6-54,0 g. Rabbits hyplus authentically surpassed animals of the Sew Zealand and Californian breeds in these indicators. The relative gain of live weight between breeds during 45-120 days differed slightly.
